page.section:
To the right honorable my very singular good Lord
e Earle of Essex.
page.lettertext:
fol.124r
May it please yo
r
good L. The want of
some answear to my former l
res
, wherof I thinke
the onely cause is a contrarie winde, hath al-
most brought me to a non plus, in mine owne
negotiations. And for
e occurrence of this c
o
trey,
it hath yelded nothing of moment for a great
while together: and
at litle w
ch
is nowe, I have
written, as yow see, by
e copie heereinclosed:
w
ch
I knowe yo
r
L. will accept, till better ma-
ter be p
nt
ed:
and so I take my humble leave.
From
e Hage. 13 A
p
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
